sa.text:
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच
धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः।
मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय॥१-१॥
sa.transliteration:
dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ
māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāś caiva kim akurvata sañjaya

en.text: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do when they had assembled together on the holy plain of Kurukshetra, eager for battle?

sa.text:
सञ्जय उवाच
दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा।
आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत्॥१-२॥
sa.transliteration:
sañjaya uvāca
dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavānīkaṃ vyūḍhaṃ duryodhanas tadā
ācāryam upasaṅgamya rājā vacanam abravīt

en.text: Sanjaya said: Then King Duryodhana, having seen the Pandava army arrayed, approached his teacher Drona and spoke these words.

sa.text:
पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम्।
व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता॥१-३॥
sa.transliteration:
paśyaitāṃ pāṇḍuputrāṇām ācārya mahatīṃ camūm
vyūḍhāṃ drupadaputreṇa tava śiṣyeṇa dhīmatā

en.text: Behold, O Teacher, this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by the son of Drupada, your wise disciple.

sa.text:
अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि।
युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः॥१-४॥
sa.transliteration:
atra śūrā maheṣvāsā bhīmārjunasamā yudhi
yuyudhāno virāṭaś ca drupadaś ca mahārathaḥ

en.text: Here are heroes, mighty archers, equal in battle to Bhima and Arjuna: Yuyudhana, Virata, and Drupada, the great charioteer.

sa.text:
धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान्।
पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः॥१-५॥
sa.transliteration:
dhṛṣṭaketuś cekitānaḥ kāśirājaś ca vīryavān
purujit kuntibhojaś ca śaibyaś ca narapuṅgavaḥ

en.text: Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, the valiant king of Kashi, Purujit, Kuntibhoja, and Shaibya, the best of men.

sa.text:
युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान्।
सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः॥१-६॥
sa.transliteration:
yudhāmanyuś ca vikrānta uttamaujāś ca vīryavān
saubhadro draupadeyāś ca sarva eva mahārathāḥ

en.text: The valiant Yudhamanyu, the mighty Uttamauja, the son of Subhadra, and the sons of Draupadi; all of them great charioteers.

sa.text:
अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम।
नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते॥१-७॥
sa.transliteration:
asmākaṃ tu viśiṣṭā ye tān nibodha dvijottama
nāyakā mama sainyasya saṃjñārthaṃ tān bravīmi te

en.text: Know also, O best of the twice-born, the leaders of my army, who are especially distinguished. For your information, I name them.

sa.text:
भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिञ्जयः।
अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च॥१-८॥
sa.transliteration:
bhavān bhīṣmaś ca karṇaś ca kṛpaś ca samitiñjayaḥ
aśvatthāmā vikarṇaś ca saumadattis tathaiva ca

en.text: Yourself, Bhishma, Karna, Kripa the victorious in battle, Ashwatthama, Vikarna, and also the son of Somadatta.

sa.text:
अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः।
नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः॥१-९॥
sa.transliteration:
anye ca bahavaḥ śūrā madarthe tyaktajīvitāḥ
nānāśastrapraharaṇāḥ sarve yuddhaviśāradāḥ

en.text: And many other heroes who have risked their lives for my sake, armed with various weapons, all skilled in battle.

sa.text:
अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम्।
पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम्॥१-१०॥
sa.transliteration:
aparyāptaṃ tad asmākaṃ balaṃ bhīṣmābhirakṣitam
paryāptaṃ tv idam eteṣāṃ balaṃ bhīmābhirakṣitam

en.text: Our army, protected by Bhishma, is unlimited; but their army, protected by Bhima, is limited.

sa.text:
अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिताः।
भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि॥१-११॥
sa.transliteration:
ayaneṣu ca sarveṣu yathābhāgam avasthitāḥ
bhīṣmam evābhirakṣantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi

en.text: Therefore, all of you, stationed in your respective positions on all fronts, guard Bhishma alone.

sa.text:
तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः।
सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चैः शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान्॥१-१२॥
sa.transliteration:
tasya sañjanayan harṣaṃ kuruvṛddhaḥ pitāmahaḥ
siṃhanādaṃ vinadyoccaiḥ śaṅkhaṃ dadhmau pratāpavān

en.text: Then the venerable grandsire Bhishma, the eldest of the Kurus, roared like a lion and blew his conch loudly, gladdening the heart of Duryodhana.

sa.text:
ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः।
सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत्॥१-१३॥
sa.transliteration:
tataḥ śaṅkhāś ca bheryaś ca paṇavānakagomukhāḥ
sahasaivābhyahanyanta sa śabdas tumulo 'bhavat

en.text: Then suddenly conches, kettledrums, tabors, drums and cow-horns blared forth, and the sound was tremendous.

sa.text:
ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ।
माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः॥१-१४॥
sa.transliteration:
tataḥ śvetair hayair yukte mahati syandane sthitau
mādhavaḥ pāṇḍavaś caiva divyau śaṅkhau pradadhmatuḥ

en.text: Then, stationed in their great chariot yoked with white horses, Madhava (Krishna) and the son of Pandu (Arjuna) blew their divine conches.

sa.text:
पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः।
पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः॥१-१५॥
sa.transliteration:
pāñcajanyaṃ hṛṣīkeśo devadattaṃ dhanañjayaḥ
pauṇḍraṃ dadhmau mahāśaṅkhaṃ bhīmakarmā vṛkodaraḥ

en.text: Hrishikesha (Krishna) blew the Panchajanya, Dhananjaya (Arjuna) blew the Devadatta, and Bhima of terrible deeds blew the great conch Paundra.

sa.text:
अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः।
नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ॥१-१६॥
sa.transliteration:
anantavijayaṃ rājā kuntīputro yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
nakulaḥ sahadevaś ca sughoṣamaṇipuṣpakau

en.text: King Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, blew the Anantavijaya; Nakula and Sahadeva blew the Sughosha and Manipushpaka.

sa.text:
काश्यश्च परमेष्वासः शिखण्डी च महारथः।
धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजितः॥१-१७॥
sa.transliteration:
kāśyaś ca parameṣvāsaḥ śikhaṇḍī ca mahārathaḥ
dhṛṣṭadyumno virāṭaś ca sātyakiś cāparājitaḥ

en.text: The king of Kashi, an excellent archer, Shikhandi the great charioteer, Dhrishtadyumna, Virata, and the unconquered Satyaki.

sa.text:
द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वशः पृथिवीपते।
सौभद्रश्च महाबाहुः शङ्खान्दध्मुः पृथक्पृथक्॥१-१८॥
sa.transliteration:
drupado draupadeyāś ca sarvaśaḥ pṛthivīpate
saubhadraś ca mahābāhuḥ śaṅkhān dadhmuḥ pṛthak pṛthak

en.text: Drupada, the sons of Draupadi, O Lord of the Earth, and the mighty-armed son of Subhadra, each blew their respective conches.

sa.text:
स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत्।
नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलोऽभ्यनुनादयन्॥१-१९॥
sa.transliteration:
sa ghoṣo dhārtarāṣṭrāṇāṃ hṛdayāni vyadārayat
nabhaś ca pṛthivīṃ caiva tumulo 'bhyanunādayan

en.text: That tumultuous sound, resounding through heaven and earth, rent the hearts of the sons of Dhritarashtra.

sa.text:
अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान् कपिध्वजः।
प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः॥
हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते॥१-२०॥
sa.transliteration:
atha vyavasthitān dṛṣṭvā dhārtarāṣṭrān kapidhvajaḥ
pravṛtte śastrasampāte dhanur udyamya pāṇḍavaḥ
hṛṣīkeśaṃ tadā vākyam idam āha mahīpate

en.text: Then, O King, seeing the sons of Dhritarashtra arrayed and the discharge of weapons about to begin, Arjuna, the son of Pandu, whose banner bore the emblem of Hanuman, took up his bow and spoke these words to Hrishikesha (Krishna).

sa.text:
अर्जुन उवाच
सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत।
यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान्॥
कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन् रणसमुद्यमे॥१-२१॥
sa.transliteration:
arjuna uvāca
senayor ubhayor madhye rathaṃ sthāpaya me 'cyuta
yāvad etān nirīkṣe 'haṃ yoddhukāmān avasthitān
kair mayā saha yoddhavyam asmin raṇasamudyame

en.text: Arjuna said: O Achyuta, please place my chariot between the two armies so that I may see those who stand here desirous to fight, and know with whom I must contend in this battle.

sa.text:
योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः।
धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षवः॥१-२२॥
sa.transliteration:
yotsyamānān avekṣe 'haṃ ya ete 'tra samāgatāḥ
dhārtarāṣṭrasya durbuddher yuddhe priyacikīrṣavaḥ

en.text: So that I may see those assembled here to fight, wishing to please in battle the evil-minded son of Dhritarashtra.

sa.text:
सञ्जय उवाच
एवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत।
सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम्॥१-२३॥
sa.transliteration:
sañjaya uvāca
evam ukto hṛṣīkeśo guḍākeśena bhārata
senayor ubhayor madhye sthāpayitvā rathottamam

en.text: Sanjaya said: O descendant of Bharata, thus addressed by Gudakesha (Arjuna), Hrishikesha (Krishna) placed the excellent chariot between the two armies.

sa.text:
भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम्।
उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति॥१-२४॥
sa.transliteration:
bhīṣmadroṇapramukhataḥ sarveṣāṃ ca mahīkṣitām
uvāca pārtha paśyaitān samavetān kurūn iti

en.text: In front of Bhishma, Drona, and all the rulers of the earth, He said: O Partha, behold these Kurus gathered together.

sa.text:
तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान् पार्थः पितृनथ पितामहान्।
आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातृन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा॥
श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि॥१-२५॥
sa.transliteration:
tatrāpaśyat sthitān pārthaḥ pitṛn atha pitāmahān
ācāryān mātulān bhrātṛn putrān pautrān sakhīṃs tathā
śvaśurān suhṛdaś caiva senayor ubhayor api

en.text: There Arjuna saw standing fathers and grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons, friends, as well as fathers-in-law and well-wishers in both armies.

sa.text:
तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान्।
कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत्॥१-२६॥
sa.transliteration:
tān samīkṣya sa kaunteyaḥ sarvān bandhūn avasthitān
kṛpayā parayāviṣṭo viṣīdann idam abravīt

en.text: Seeing all these relatives arrayed before him, the son of Kunti (Arjuna) was overcome with great compassion and spoke sorrowfully.

sa.text:
अर्जुन उवाच
दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम्॥१-२७॥
sa.transliteration:
arjuna uvāca
dṛṣṭvemaṃ svajanaṃ kṛṣṇa yuyutsuṃ samupasthitam

en.text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, seeing my kinsmen arrayed for battle here, my limbs fail and my mouth is parched.

sa.text:
सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति।
वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते॥१-२८॥
sa.transliteration:
sīdanti mama gātrāṇi mukhaṃ ca pariśuṣyati
vepathuś ca śarīre me romaharṣaś ca jāyate

en.text: My body trembles, my hair stands on end, my bow Gandiva slips from my hand, and my skin burns.

sa.text:
गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्चैव परिदह्यते।
न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः॥१-२९॥
sa.transliteration:
gāṇḍīvaṃ sraṃsate hastāt tvak caiva paridahyate
na ca śaknomy avasthātuṃ bhramatīva ca me manaḥ

en.text: I am unable to stand steady, my mind is reeling, and I see adverse omens, O Keshava.

sa.text:
निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव।
न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे॥१-३०॥
sa.transliteration:
nimittāni ca paśyāmi viparītāni keśava
na ca śreyo 'nupaśyāmi hatvā svajanam āhave

en.text: I see no good in killing my kinsmen in battle. I desire neither victory, nor kingdom, nor pleasures.

sa.text:
न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च।
किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा॥१-३१॥
sa.transliteration:
na kāṅkṣe vijayaṃ kṛṣṇa na ca rājyaṃ sukhāni ca
kiṃ no rājyena govinda kiṃ bhogair jīvitena vā

en.text: Of what use is a kingdom to us, O Govinda? Of what use are pleasures or even life itself when those for whose sake we desire kingdom, enjoyments and pleasures stand here in battle?

sa.text:
येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च।
त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च॥१-३२॥
sa.transliteration:
yeṣām arthe kāṅkṣitaṃ no rājyaṃ bhogāḥ sukhāni ca
ta ime 'vasthitā yuddhe prāṇāṃs tyaktvā dhanāni ca

en.text: Teachers, fathers, sons, as well as grandfathers, maternal uncles, fathers-in-law, grandsons, brothers-in-law, and other relatives—they are all ready to give up their lives and wealth for my sake.

sa.text:
आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः।
मातुलाः श्वशुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा॥१-३३॥
sa.transliteration:
ācāryāḥ pitaraḥ putrās tathaiva ca pitāmahāḥ
mātulāḥ śvaśurāḥ pautrāḥ śyālāḥ sambandhinas tathā

en.text: Even if they kill me, I do not wish to kill them, not even for the sovereignty of the three worlds, let alone for this earthly kingdom, O Madhusudana.

sa.text:
एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन।
अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते॥१-३४॥
sa.transliteration:
etān na hantum icchāmi ghnato 'pi madhusūdana
api trailokyarājyasya hetoḥ kiṃ nu mahīkṛte

en.text: What pleasure shall we derive from killing the sons of Dhritarashtra, O Janardana? Sin alone will cling to us if we slay these aggressors.

sa.text:
निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्जनार्दन।
पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिनः॥१-३५॥
sa.transliteration:
nihatya dhārtarāṣṭrān naḥ kā prītiḥ syāj janārdana
pāpam evāśrayed asmān hatvaitān ātatāyinaḥ

en.text: Therefore, we should not kill the sons of Dhritarashtra, our relatives. How can we be happy by killing our own kinsmen, O Madhava?

sa.text:
तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्स्वबान्धवान्।
स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव॥१-३६॥
sa.transliteration:
tasmān nārhā vayaṃ hantuṃ dhārtarāṣṭrān svabāndhavān
svajanaṃ hi kathaṃ hatvā sukhinaḥ syāma mādhava

en.text: Even if they, whose minds are overpowered by greed, see no fault in killing their relatives or quarreling with friends,

sa.text:
यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः।
कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम्॥१-३७॥
sa.transliteration:
yady apy ete na paśyanti lobhopahatacetasaḥ
kulakṣayakṛtaṃ doṣaṃ mitradrohe ca pātakam

en.text: Why should we, who clearly see the crime in destroying a family, not turn away from this sin, O Janardana?

sa.text:
कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम्।
कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन॥१-३८॥
sa.transliteration:
kathaṃ na jñeyam asmābhiḥ pāpād asmān nivartitum
kulakṣayakṛtaṃ doṣaṃ prapaśyadbhir janārdana

en.text: With the destruction of the family, the eternal family traditions perish, and thereafter unrighteousness prevails in the family.

sa.text:
कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः।
धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत॥१-३९॥
sa.transliteration:
kulakṣaye praṇaśyanti kuladharmāḥ sanātanāḥ
dharma naṣṭe kulaṃ kṛtsnam adharmo 'bhibhavaty uta

en.text: When unrighteousness prevails, O Krishna, the women of the family become corrupt; and when women become corrupt, social chaos arises.

sa.text:
अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः।
स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः॥१-४०॥
sa.transliteration:
adharmābhibhavāt kṛṣṇa praduṣyanti kulastriyaḥ
strīṣu duṣṭāsu vārṣṇeya jāyate varṇasaṅkaraḥ

en.text: This intermixture of castes leads the family and the slayers of the family to hell, for their ancestors fall, deprived of the offerings of rice-ball and water.

sa.text:
सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्नानां कुलस्य च।
पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः॥१-४१॥
sa.transliteration:
saṅkaro narakāyaiva kulaghnānāṃ kulasya ca
patanti pitaro hy eṣāṃ luptapiṇḍodakakriyāḥ

en.text: By the evil deeds of those who destroy the family, which cause intermixture of castes, the eternal traditions of the family and community are destroyed.

sa.text:
दोषैरेतैः कुलघ्नानां वर्णसङ्करकारकैः।
उत्साद्यन्ते जातिधर्माः कुलधर्माश्च शाश्वताः॥१-४२॥
sa.transliteration:
doṣair etaiḥ kulaghnānāṃ varṇasaṅkarakārakaiḥ
utsādyante jātidharmāḥ kuladharmāś ca śāśvatāḥ

en.text: Men whose family traditions are destroyed dwell in hell for an indefinite period of time, so we have heard.

sa.text:
उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन।
नरकेऽनियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुशुश्रुम॥१-४३॥
sa.transliteration:
utsannakuladharmāṇāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ janārdana
narake 'niyataṃ vāso bhavatīty anuśuśruma

en.text: Alas! We are resolved to commit a great sin, as we are trying to kill our kinsmen out of greed for the pleasures of the kingdom.

sa.text:
अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम्।
यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यताः॥१-४४॥
sa.transliteration:
aho bata mahat pāpaṃ kartuṃ vyavasitā vayam
yad rājyasukhalobhena hantuṃ svajanam udyatāḥ

en.text: It would be better for me if the sons of Dhritarashtra, weapons in hand, should slay me unarmed and unresisting in the battle.

sa.text:
यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः।
धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत्॥१-४५॥
sa.transliteration:
yadi mām apratīkāram aśastraṃ śastrapāṇayaḥ
dhārtarāṣṭrā raṇe hanyus tan me kṣemataraṃ bhavet

en.text: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus on the battlefield, Arjuna cast aside his bow and arrows and sank into the seat of his chariot, his mind overcome with grief.

sa.text:
सञ्जय उवाच
एवमुक्त्वार्जुनः सङ्ख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत्।
विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्नमानसः॥१-४६॥
sa.transliteration:
sañjaya uvāca
evam uktvārjunaḥ saṅkhye rathopastha upāviśat
visṛjya saśaraṃ cāpaṃ śokasaṃvignamānasaḥ

en.text: Thus ends the first chapter named Arjuna's Despair of the Bhagavad Gita, the science of Yoga, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna.

sa.text: ॥ इति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादेऽर्जुनविषादयोगो नाम प्रथमोऽध्यायः॥
sa.transliteration: iti śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde 'rjunaviṣādayogo nāma prathamo 'dhyāyaḥ

en.text: Thus ends the first chapter named Arjuna's Despair of the Bhagavad Gita, the science of Yoga, in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna.

sa.text:
सञ्जय उवाच
तं तथा कृपयाविष्टमश्रुपूर्णाकुलेक्षणम्।
विषीदन्तमिदं वाक्यमुवाच मधुसूदनः॥२-१॥
sa.transliteration:
sañjaya uvāca
taṃ tathā kṛpayāviṣṭam aśrupūrṇākulekṣaṇam
viṣīdantam idaṃ vākyam uvāca madhusūdanaḥ

en.text: Sanjaya said: To him who was thus overcome with pity, whose eyes were filled with tears and troubled, and who was despondent, Madhusudana (Krishna) spoke these words.

sa.text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
कुतस्त्वा कश्मलमिदं विषमे समुपस्थितम्।
अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यमकीर्तिकरमर्जुन॥२-२॥
sa.transliteration:
śrībhagavān uvāca
kutas tvā kaśmalam idaṃ viṣame samupasthitam
anāryajuṣṭam asvargyam akīrtikaram arjuna

en.text: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, from where has this delusion, this disgraceful weakness, this un-Aryan, heaven-barring, and dishonorable attitude come upon you at this critical juncture?

sa.text:
क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते।
क्षुद्रं हृदयदौर्बल्यं त्यक्त्वोत्तिष्ठ परन्तप॥२-३॥
sa.transliteration:
klaibyaṃ mā sma gamaḥ pārtha naitat tvayy upapadyate
kṣudraṃ hṛdayadaurbalyaṃ tyaktvottiṣṭha parantapa

en.text: Yield not to unmanliness, O son of Pritha. It does not befit you. Shake off this petty faint-heartedness and arise, O scorcher of foes.

sa.text:
अर्जुन उवाच
कथं भीष्ममहं सङ्ख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन।
इषुभिः प्रतियोत्स्यामि पूजार्हावरिसूदन॥२-४॥
sa.transliteration:
arjuna uvāca
kathaṃ bhīṣmam ahaṃ saṅkhye droṇaṃ ca madhusūdana
iṣubhiḥ pratiyotsyāmi pūjārhāv arisūdana

en.text: Arjuna said: O Madhusudana (slayer of Madhu), how can I fight with arrows in battle against Bhishma and Drona, who are worthy of worship, O slayer of enemies?

sa.text:
गुरूनहत्वा हि महानुभावान्श्रेयो भोक्तुं भैक्ष्यमपीह लोके।
हत्वार्थकामांस्तु गुरूनिहैव भुञ्जीय भोगान् रुधिरप्रदिग्धान्॥२-५॥
sa.transliteration:
gurūn ahatvā hi mahānubhāvān śreyo bhoktuṃ bhaikṣyam apīha loke
hatvārthakāmāṃs tu gurūn ihaiva bhuñjīya bhogān rudhirapradigdhān

en.text: It is better to live in this world by begging than to slay these noble teachers. By killing them, I would enjoy pleasures stained with blood.

sa.text:
न चैतद्विद्मः कतरन्नो गरीयो यद्वा जयेम यदि वा नो जयेयुः।
यानेव हत्वा न जिजीविषामस् तेऽवस्थिताः प्रमुखे धार्तराष्ट्राः॥२-६॥
sa.transliteration:
na caitad vidmaḥ kataranno garīyo yadvā jayema yadi vā no jayeyuḥ
yān eva hatvā na jijīviṣāmas te 'vasthitāḥ pramukhe dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ

en.text: Nor do we know which is better for us—to conquer them or to be conquered by them. After killing the sons of Dhritarashtra, we would not wish to live. Yet they stand before us, having taken up arms.

sa.text:
कार्पण्यदोषोपहतस्वभावः पृच्छामि त्वां धर्मसम्मूढचेताः।
यच्छ्रेयः स्यान्निश्चितं ब्रूहि तन्मे शिष्यस्तेऽहं शाधि मां त्वां प्रपन्नम्॥२-७॥
sa.transliteration:
kārpaṇyadoṣopahatasvabhāvaḥ pṛcchāmi tvāṃ dhammasammūḍhacetāḥ
yac chreyaḥ syān niścitaṃ brūhi tan me śiṣyas te 'haṃ śādhi māṃ tvāṃ prapannam

en.text: My nature afflicted with the taint of faint-heartedness, my mind confused about duty, I ask You: Tell me decisively what is good for me. I am Your disciple. Instruct me, who has taken refuge in You.

sa.text:
न हि प्रपश्यामि ममापनुद्याद्यच्छोकमुच्छोषणमिन्द्रियाणाम्।
अवाप्य भूमावसपत्नमृद्धं राज्यं सुराणामपि चाधिपत्यम्॥२-८॥
sa.transliteration:
na hi prapaśyāmi mamāpanudyād yac chokam ucchoṣaṇam indriyāṇām
avāpya bhūmāv asapatnam ṛddhaṃ rājyaṃ surāṇām api cādhipatyam

en.text: I do not see that it would remove this sorrow that burns my senses, even if I should attain prosperous and unrivaled dominion on earth or lordship over the gods.

sa.text:
सञ्जय उवाच
एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशं गुडाकेशः परन्तपः।
न योत्स्य इति गोविन्दमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं बभूव ह॥२-९॥
sa.transliteration:
sañjaya uvāca
evam uktvā hṛṣīkeśaṃ guḍākeśaḥ parantapaḥ
na yotsya iti govindam uktvā tūṣṇīṃ babhūva ha

en.text: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus to Hrishikesha, Gudakesha (Arjuna), the scorcher of foes, said to Govinda, "I will not fight," and became silent.

sa.text:
तमुवाच हृषीकेशः प्रहसन्निव भारत।
सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये विषीदन्तमिदं वचः॥२-१०॥
sa.transliteration:
tam uvāca hṛṣīkeśaḥ prahasann iva bhārata
senayor ubhayor madhye viṣīdantam idaṃ vacaḥ

en.text: O descendant of Bharata, at that time Hrishikesha, smiling as it were, spoke these words to the despondent Arjuna, who was situated between the two armies.

sa.text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
अशोच्यानन्वशोचस्त्वं प्रज्ञावादांश्च भाषसे।
गतासूनगतासूंश्च नानुशोचन्ति पण्डिताः॥२-११॥
sa.transliteration:
śrībhagavān uvāca
aśocyān anvaśocas tvaṃ prajñāvādāṃś ca bhāṣase
 gatāsūn agatāsūṃś ca nānuśocanti paṇḍitāḥ

en.text: The Blessed Lord said: You grieve for those who should not be grieved for, yet you speak words of wisdom. The wise grieve neither for the living nor for the dead.

sa.text:
न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः।
न चैव न भविष्यामः सर्वे वयमतः परम्॥२-१२॥
sa.transliteration:
na tvevāhaṃ jātu nāsaṃ na tvaṃ neme janādhipāḥ
na caiva na bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarve vayam ataḥ param

en.text: Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings; nor in the future shall any of us cease to be.

sa.text:
देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा।
तथा देहान्तरप्राप्तिर्धीरस्तत्र न मुह्यति॥२-१३॥
sa.transliteration:
dehino 'smin yathā dehe kaumāraṃ yauvanaṃ jarā
tathā dehāntaraprāptir dhīras tatra na muhyati

en.text: Just as the embodied self passes through childhood, youth, and old age in this body, so does it pass into another body. The wise are not deluded by this.

sa.text:
मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःखदाः।
आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत॥२-१४॥
sa.transliteration:
mātrāsparśās tu kaunteya śītoṣṇasukhaduḥkhadāḥ
āgamāpāyino 'nityās tāṃs titikṣasva bhārata

en.text: O son of Kunti, contacts with matter give rise to heat and cold, pleasure and pain. They come and go and are impermanent. Endure them bravely, O descendant of Bharata.

sa.text:
यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ।
समदुःखसुखं धीरं सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते॥२-१५॥
sa.transliteration:
yaṃ hi na vyathayanty ete puruṣaṃ puruṣarṣabha
samaduḥkhasukhaṃ dhīraṃ so 'mṛtatvāya kalpate

en.text: That person who is not disturbed by these, O best of men, who is steady in pleasure and pain, is fit for immortality.

sa.text:
नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः।
उभयोरपि दृष्टोऽन्तस्त्वनयोस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः॥२-१६॥
sa.transliteration:
nāsato vidyate bhāvo nābhāvo vidyate sataḥ
ubhayor api dṛṣṭo 'ntas tv anayos tattvadarśibhiḥ

en.text: The unreal has no existence; the real never ceases to be. The truth about both has been seen by the seers of reality.

sa.text:
अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्।
विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित्कर्तुमर्हति॥२-१७॥
sa.transliteration:
avināśi tu tad viddhi yena sarvam idaṃ tatam
vināśam avyayasyāsya na kaścit kartum arhati

en.text: Know that by which all this is pervaded to be indestructible. No one can bring about the destruction of this immutable being.

sa.text:
अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः।
अनाशिनोऽप्रमेयस्य तस्माद्युध्यस्व भारत॥२-१८॥
sa.transliteration:
antavanta ime dehā nityasyoktāḥ śarīriṇaḥ
anāśino 'prameyasya tasmād yudhyasva bhārata

en.text: These bodies of the eternal, imperishable, and immeasurable embodied self are said to be perishable. Therefore fight, O descendant of Bharata.

sa.text:
य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम्।
उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते॥२-१९॥
sa.transliteration:
ya enaṃ vetti hantāraṃ yaś cainaṃ manyate hatam
ubhau tau na vijānīto nāyaṃ hanti na hanyate

en.text: He who thinks that the self slays, and he who thinks that it is slain, are both ignorant. The self neither slays nor is slain.

sa.text:
न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचिन्नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः।
अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे॥२-२०॥
sa.transliteration:
na jāyate mriyate vā kadācin nāyaṃ bhūtvā bhavitā vā na bhūyaḥ
ajo nityaḥ śāśvato 'yaṃ purāṇo na hanyate hanyamāne śarīre

en.text: The self is never born nor does it ever die; nor having come into existence will it again cease to be. It is unborn, eternal, everlasting, and primeval. It is not slain when the body is slain.

sa.text:
वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम्।
कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम्॥२-२१॥
sa.transliteration:
vedāvināśinaṃ nityaṃ ya enam ajam avyayam
kathaṃ sa puruṣaḥ pārtha kaṃ ghātayati hanti kam

en.text: O Partha, how can that person who knows the self to be indestructible, eternal, unborn, and immutable cause anyone to be slain or slay anyone?

sa.text:
वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि।
तथा शरीराणि विहाय जीर्णान्यन्यानि संयाति नवानि देही॥२-२२॥
sa.transliteration:
vāsāṃsi jīrṇāni yathā vihāya navāni gṛhṇāti naro 'parāṇi
tathā śarīrāṇi vihāya jīrṇāny anyāni saṃyāti navāni dehī

en.text: Just as a person casts off worn-out garments and puts on others that are new, even so the embodied self casts off worn-out bodies and enters others that are new.

sa.text:
नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः।
न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः॥२-२३॥
sa.transliteration:
nainaṃ chindanti śastrāṇi nainaṃ dahati pāvakaḥ
na cainaṃ kledayanty āpo na śoṣayati mārutaḥ

en.text: Weapons cannot cut the self, nor can fire burn it; water cannot wet it, nor can wind dry it.

sa.text:
अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च।
नित्यः सर्वगतः स्थाणुरचलोऽयं सनातनः॥२-२४॥
sa.transliteration:
acchedyo 'yam adāhyo 'yam akledyo 'śoṣya eva ca
nityaḥ sarvagataḥ sthāṇur acalo 'yaṃ sanātanaḥ

en.text: The self is uncleavable, incombustible, unwettable, and undryable. It is eternal, all-pervading, stable, immovable, and primeval.

sa.text:
अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकार्योऽयमुच्यते।
तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि॥२-२५॥
sa.transliteration:
avyakto 'yam acintyo 'yam avikāryo 'yam ucyate
tasmād evaṃ viditvainaṃ nānuśocitum arhasi

en.text: The self is said to be unmanifest, unthinkable, and immutable. Therefore, knowing it as such, you should not grieve.

sa.text:
अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम्।
तथापि त्वं महाबाहो नैवं शोचितुमर्हसि॥२-२६॥
sa.transliteration:
atha cainaṃ nityajātaṃ nityaṃ vā manyase mṛtam
tathāpi tvaṃ mahābāho naivaṃ śocitum arhasi

en.text: Even if you think that the self is perpetually born and perpetually dies, even then, O mighty-armed, you should not grieve.

sa.text:
जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च।
तस्मादपरिहार्येऽर्थे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि॥२-२७॥
sa.transliteration:
jātasya hi dhruvo mṛtyur dhruvaṃ janma mṛtasya ca
tasmād aparihārye 'rthe na tvaṃ śocitum arhasi

en.text: For death is certain for one who is born, and birth is certain for one who dies. Therefore, for what is unavoidable, you should not grieve.

sa.text:
अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत।
अव्यक्तनिधनान्येव तत्र का परिदेवना॥२-२८॥
sa.transliteration:
avyaktādīni bhūtāni vyaktamadhyāni bhārata
avyaktanidhanāny eva tatra kā parivedanā

en.text: All beings are unmanifest before birth, manifest in the interim, and unmanifest again after death. So why lament?

sa.text:
आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेनमाश्चर्यवद्वदति तथैव चान्यः।
आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्यः शृणोति श्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित्॥२-२९॥
sa.transliteration:
āścaryavat paśyati kaścid enam āścaryavad vadati tathaiva cānyaḥ
āścaryavac cainam anyaḥ śṛṇoti śrutvāpy enaṃ veda na caiva kaścit

en.text: One sees the self as a marvel; another speaks of it as a marvel; yet another hears of it as a marvel; but even after hearing, no one actually knows it.

sa.text:
देही नित्यमवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत।
तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि॥२-३०॥
sa.transliteration:
dehī nityam avadhyo 'yaṃ dehe sarvasya bhārata
tasmāt sarvāṇi bhūtāni na tvaṃ śocitum arhasi

en.text: The embodied self in everyone's body, O descendant of Bharata, is eternally indestructible. Therefore, you should not grieve for any creature.

sa.text:
स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि।
धर्म्याद्धि युद्धाच्छ्रेयोऽन्यत्क्षत्रियस्य न विद्यते॥२-३१॥
sa.transliteration:
svadharmam api cāvekṣya na vikampitum arhasi
dharmyād dhi yuddhāc chreyo 'nyat kṣatriyasya na vidyate

en.text: Considering your own duty as a Kshatriya, you should not waver, for there is nothing more auspicious for a Kshatriya than a righteous war.

sa.text:
यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम्।
सुखिनः क्षत्रियाः पार्थ लभन्ते युद्धमीदृशम्॥२-३२॥
sa.transliteration:
yadṛcchayā copapannaṃ svargadvāram apāvṛtam
sukhinaḥ kṣatriyāḥ pārtha labhante yuddham īdṛśam

en.text: Happy are the Kshatriyas, O Partha, to whom such a war comes unsought, opening for them the doors of heaven.

sa.text:
अथ चेत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं सङ्ग्रामं न करिष्यसि।
ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि॥२-३३॥
sa.transliteration:
atha cet tvam imaṃ dharmyaṃ saṅgrāmaṃ na kariṣyasi
tataḥ svadharmaṃ kīrtiṃ ca hitvā pāpam avāpsyasi

en.text: If, however, you do not fight this righteous war, then, having abandoned your duty and honor, you will incur sin.

sa.text:
अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम्।
सम्भावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते॥२-३४॥
sa.transliteration:
akīrtiṃ cāpi bhūtāni kathayiṣyanti te 'vyayām
sambhāvitasya cākīrtir maraṇād atiricyate

en.text: People will forever speak of your infamy, and for one who has been honored, dishonor is worse than death.

sa.text:
भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथाः।
येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम्॥२-३५॥
sa.transliteration:
bhayād raṇād uparataṃ maṃsyante tvāṃ mahārathāḥ
yeṣāṃ ca tvaṃ bahumato bhūtvā yāsyasi lāghavam

en.text: The great charioteers will think that you have withdrawn from battle out of fear, and you, who were highly esteemed by them, will be thought lightly of.

sa.text:
अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून्वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः।
निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम्॥२-३६॥
sa.transliteration:
avācyavādāṃś ca bahūn vadiṣyanti tavāhitāḥ
nindantas tava sāmarthyaṃ tato duḥkhataraṃ nu kim

en.text: Your enemies will speak many unmentionable words, disparaging your prowess. What could be more painful than that?

sa.text:
हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम्।
तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चयः॥२-३७॥
sa.transliteration:
hato vā prāpsyasi svargaṃ jitvā vā bhokṣyase mahīm
tasmād uttiṣṭha kaunteya yuddhāya kṛtaniścayaḥ

en.text: If you are killed, you will attain heaven; if victorious, you will enjoy the earth. Therefore, arise, O son of Kunti, resolved to fight.

sa.text:
सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ।
ततो युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि॥२-३८॥
sa.transliteration:
sukhaduḥkhe same kṛtvā lābhālābhau jayājayau
tato yuddhāya yujyasva naivaṃ pāpam avāpsyasi

en.text: Fight, treating alike pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat. By doing so, you will not incur sin.

sa.text:
एषा तेऽभिहिता साङ्ख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु।
बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि॥२-३९॥
sa.transliteration:
eṣā te 'bhihitā sāṅkhye buddhir yoge tv imāṃ śṛṇu
buddhyā yukto yayā pārtha karmabandhaṃ prahāsyasi

en.text: Thus far I have explained to you the wisdom of Sankhya. Now listen to the wisdom of Yoga, endowed with which, O Partha, you will break the bonds of karma.

sa.text:
नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते।
स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात्॥२-४०॥
sa.transliteration:
nehābhikramanāśo 'sti pratyavāyo na vidyate
svalpam apy asya dharmasya trāyate mahato bhayāt

en.text: In this path, no effort is ever lost, nor is there any danger of adverse results. Even a little practice of this dharma protects one from great fear.

sa.text:
व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन।
बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम्॥२-४१॥
sa.transliteration:
vyavasāyātmikā buddhir ekeha kurunandana
bahuśākhā hy anantāś ca buddhayo 'vyavasāyinām

en.text: O joy of the Kurus, the intellect of those who are resolute is single-pointed, whereas the thoughts of the irresolute are many-branched and endless.

sa.text:
यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चितः।
वेदवादरताः पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिनः॥२-४२॥
sa.transliteration:
yām imāṃ puṣpitāṃ vācaṃ pravadanty avipaścitaḥ
vedavādaratāḥ pārtha nānyad astīti vādinaḥ

en.text: Flowery speech is uttered by the unwise, who take pleasure in the words of the Vedas, saying, "There is nothing else."

sa.text:
कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम्।
क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति॥२-४३॥
sa.transliteration:
kāmātmānaḥ svargaparā janmakarmaphalapradām
kriyāviśeṣabahulāṃ bhogaiśvaryagatiṃ prati

en.text: Full of desires, having heaven as their goal, they utter flowery words that promise birth as the result of actions, and prescribe various rituals for the attainment of pleasure and power.

sa.text:
भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयाऽपहृतचेतसाम्।
व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिः समाधौ न विधीयते॥२-४४॥
sa.transliteration:
bhogaiśvaryaprasaktānāṃ tayāpahṛtacetasām
vyavasāyātmikā buddhiḥ samādhau na vidhīyate

en.text: In the minds of those who are overly attached to pleasure and power, and whose discernment is stolen by such talk, the resolute intellect for concentration does not develop.

sa.text:
त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन।
निर्द्वन्द्वो नित्यसत्त्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान्॥२-४५॥
sa.transliteration:
traiguṇyaviṣayā vedā nistraiguṇyo bhavārjuna
nirdvandvo nityasattvastho niryogakṣema ātmavān

en.text: The Vedas deal with the three gunas (modes of material nature). O Arjuna, be free from the three gunas, free from duality, ever steadfast in purity, free from the thought of acquisition and preservation, and established in the self.

sa.text:
यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः सम्प्लुतोदके।
तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः॥२-४६॥
sa.transliteration:
yāvān artha udapāne sarvataḥ samplutodake
tāvān sarveṣu vedeṣu brāhmaṇasya vijānataḥ

en.text: To the enlightened brahmana, all the Vedas are of as much use as a small water reservoir is when there is a flood everywhere.

sa.text:
कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन।
मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि॥२-४७॥
sa.transliteration:
karmaṇy evādhikāras te mā phaleṣu kadācana
mā karmaphalahetur bhūr mā te saṅgo 'stv akarmaṇi

en.text: You have a right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions. Never consider yourself the cause of the results of your activities, nor be attached to inaction.

sa.text:
योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय।
सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते॥२-४८॥
sa.transliteration:
yogasthaḥ kuru karmaṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā dhanañjaya
 siddhyasiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvā samatvaṃ yoga ucyate

en.text: Perform your duties equipoised, O Dhananjaya, abandoning all attachment to success or failure. Such equanimity is called yoga.

sa.text:
दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय।
बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः॥२-४९॥
sa.transliteration:
dūreṇa hy avaraṃ karma buddhiyogād dhanañjaya
buddhau śaraṇam anviccha kṛpaṇāḥ phalahetavaḥ

en.text: Far inferior indeed is mere action to the yoga of wisdom, O Dhananjaya. Seek refuge in wisdom; wretched are those who are motivated by the fruits of action.

sa.text:
बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते।
तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम्॥२-५०॥
sa.transliteration:
buddhiyukto jahātīha ubhe sukṛtaduṣkṛte
tasmād yogāya yujyasva yogaḥ karmasu kauśalam

en.text: Endowed with wisdom, one casts off in this life both good and bad deeds. Therefore, strive for yoga; yoga is skill in action.

sa.text:
कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः।
जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ताः पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम्॥२-५१॥
sa.transliteration:
karmajaṃ buddhiyuktā hi phalaṃ tyaktvā manīṣiṇaḥ
janmabandhavinirmuktāḥ padaṃ gacchanty anāmayam

en.text: The wise, endowed with wisdom, renouncing the fruits born of actions, freed from the bondage of birth, go to the state beyond suffering.

sa.text:
यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति।
तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च॥२-५२॥
sa.transliteration:
yadā te mohakalilaṃ buddhir vyatitariṣyati
tadā gantāsi nirvedaṃ śrotavyasya śrutasya ca

en.text: When your intellect crosses the mire of delusion, then you will attain indifference to what has been heard and what is yet to be heard.

sa.text:
श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला।
समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि॥२-५३॥
sa.transliteration:
śrutivipratipannā te yadā sthāsyati niścalā
samādhāvacalā buddhis tadā yogam avāpsyasi

en.text: When your intellect, which is bewildered by the Vedic texts, shall stand firm and steady in concentration, then you shall attain yoga.

sa.text:
अर्जुन उवाच
स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव।
स्थितधीः किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम्॥२-५४॥
sa.transliteration:
arjuna uvāca
sthitaprajñasya kā bhāṣā samādhisthasya keśava
sthitadhīḥ kiṃ prabhāṣeta kim āsīta vrajeta kim

en.text: Arjuna said: O Keshava, what is the description of one who is steady in wisdom, absorbed in samadhi? How does the person of steady wisdom speak, sit, and walk?

sa.text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान्पार्थ मनोगतान्।
आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्टः स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते॥२-५५॥
sa.transliteration:
śrībhagavān uvāca
prajahāti yadā kāmān sarvān pārtha manogatān
ātmany evātmanā tuṣṭaḥ sthitaprajñas tadocyate

en.text: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, when one fully renounces all desires that enter the mind, and is satisfied in the self by the self, then one is said to be steady in wisdom.

sa.text:
दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः।
वीतरागभयक्रोधः स्थितधीर्मुनिरुच्यते॥२-५६॥
sa.transliteration:
duḥkheṣv anudvignamanāḥ sukheṣu vigataspṛhaḥ
vītarāgabhayakrodhaḥ sthitadhīr munir ucyate

en.text: One whose mind is not shaken by adversity, who does not hanker after pleasures, and who is free from attachment, fear, and anger, is called a sage of steady wisdom.

sa.text:
यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम्।
नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता॥२-५७॥
sa.transliteration:
yaḥ sarvatrānabhisnehas tat tat prāpya śubhāśubham
nābhinandati na dveṣṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā

en.text: One who is without attachment anywhere, who does not rejoice or hate upon obtaining good or evil, has steady wisdom.

sa.text:
यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः।
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता॥२-५८॥
sa.transliteration:
yadā saṃharate cāyaṃ kūrmo 'ṅgānīva sarvaśaḥ
indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā

en.text: When, like a tortoise withdrawing its limbs, one withdraws the senses from sense objects, then one's wisdom becomes steady.

sa.text:
विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिनः।
रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते॥२-५९॥
sa.transliteration:
viṣayā vinivartante nirāhārasya dehinaḥ
rasavarjaṃ raso 'py asya paraṃ dṛṣṭvā nivartate

en.text: The embodied soul may restrain the senses from objects, but the taste for sense objects remains. However, even that taste ceases when the Supreme is seen.

sa.text:
यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः।
इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मनः॥२-६०॥
sa.transliteration:
yatato hy api kaunteya puruṣasya vipaścitaḥ
indriyāṇi pramāthīni haranti prasabhaṃ manaḥ

en.text: The turbulent senses, O son of Kunti, forcibly carry away the mind of even a wise person striving for perfection.

sa.text:
तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः।
वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता॥२-६१॥
sa.transliteration:
tāni sarvāṇi saṃyamya yukta āsīta matparaḥ
vaśe hi yasyendriyāṇi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā

en.text: Having restrained all the senses, one should sit steadfast, intent on Me. For, one whose senses are under control has steady wisdom.

sa.text:
ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते।
सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते॥२-६२॥
sa.transliteration:
dhyāyato viṣayān puṃsaḥ saṅgas teṣūpajāyate
saṅgāt sañjāyate kāmaḥ kāmāt krodho 'bhijāyate

en.text: When a person dwells on sense objects, attachment to them arises. From attachment arises desire, and from desire arises anger.

sa.text:
क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोहः सम्मोहात्स्मृतिविभ्रमः।
स्मृतिभ्रंशाद् बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति॥२-६३॥
sa.transliteration:
krodhād bhavati sammohaḥ sammohāt smṛtivibhramaḥ
smṛtibhraṃśād buddhināśo buddhināśāt praṇaśyati

en.text: From anger arises delusion; from delusion, confusion of memory; from confusion of memory, loss of intellect; and from loss of intellect, one perishes.

sa.text:
रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन्।
आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति॥२-६४॥
sa.transliteration:
rāgadveṣaviyuktais tu viṣayān indriyaiś caran
ātmavaśyair vidheyātmā prasādam adhigacchati

en.text: But the self-controlled person, moving among sense objects with senses free from attachment and aversion, and brought under control, attains tranquility.

sa.text:
प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते।
प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धिः पर्यवतिष्ठते॥२-६५॥
sa.transliteration:
prasāde sarvaduḥkhānāṃ hānir asyopajāyate
prasannacetaso hy āśu buddhiḥ paryavatiṣṭhate

en.text: In tranquility, all sorrow is destroyed. For the intellect of the tranquil-minded person quickly becomes steady.

sa.text:
नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावना।
न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम्॥२-६६॥
sa.transliteration:
nāsti buddhir ayuktasya na cāyuktasya bhāvanā
na cābhāvayataḥ śāntir aśāntasya kutaḥ sukham

en.text: There is no wisdom for the unintegrated person, nor meditation, nor peace. And for the unpeaceful, how can there be happiness?

sa.text:
इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते।
तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि॥२-६७॥
sa.transliteration:
indriyāṇāṃ hi caratāṃ yan mano 'nuvidhīyate
tad asya harati prajñāṃ vāyur nāvam ivāmbhasi

en.text: For, the mind that follows the wandering senses carries away one's wisdom, as the wind carries away a boat on the water.

sa.text:
तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः।
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता॥२-६८॥
sa.transliteration:
tasmād yasya mahābāho nigṛhītāni sarvaśaḥ
indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā

en.text: Therefore, O mighty-armed one, one whose senses are completely restrained from their objects has steady wisdom.

sa.text:
या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी।
यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः॥२-६९॥
sa.transliteration:
yā niśā sarvabhūtānāṃ tasyāṃ jāgarti saṃyamī
yasyāṃ jāgrati bhūtāni sā niśā paśyato muneḥ

en.text: That which is night for all beings is the time of awakening for the self-controlled; and that which is the time of awakening for all beings is night for the sage who sees.

sa.text:
आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन्ति यद्वत्।
तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी॥२-७०॥
sa.transliteration:
āpūryamāṇam acalapratiṣṭhaṃ samudram āpaḥ praviśanti yadvat
tadvat kāmā yaṃ praviśanti sarve sa śāntim āpnoti na kāmakāmī

en.text: Just as the ocean remains undisturbed by the incessant flow of waters from rivers merging into it, likewise the sage who is unmoved despite the flow of desires attains peace, and not the person who strives to satisfy desires.

sa.text:
विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निःस्पृहः।
निर्ममो निरहंकारः स शान्तिमधिगच्छति॥२-७१॥
sa.transliteration:
vihāya kāmān yaḥ sarvān pumāṃś carati niḥspṛhaḥ
nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sa śāntim adhigacchati

en.text: That person who abandons all desires and acts free from longing, without any sense of proprietorship or ego, attains peace.

sa.text:
एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति।
स्थित्वास्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति॥२-७२॥
sa.transliteration:
eṣā brāhmī sthitiḥ pārtha naināṃ prāpya vimuhyati
sthitvāsyām antakāle 'pi brahmanirvāṇam ṛcchati

en.text: This is the state of Brahman, O Partha. Having attained this, one is not deluded. Established in this state even at the hour of death, one attains liberation in Brahman.

sa.text:
अर्जुन उवाच
ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन।
तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव॥३-१॥
sa.transliteration:
arjuna uvāca
jyāyasī cet karmaṇas te matā buddhir janārdana
tat kiṃ karmaṇi ghore māṃ niyojayasi keśava

en.text: Arjuna said: O Janardana, if You consider knowledge superior to action, then why do You engage me in this terrible action, O Keshava?

sa.text:
व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे।
तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम्॥३-२॥
sa.transliteration:
vyāmiśreṇeva vākyena buddhiṃ mohayasīva me
tad ekaṃ vada niścitya yena śreyo 'ham āpnuyām

en.text: With seemingly conflicting words You confuse my understanding. Therefore, tell me decisively that one path by which I may attain the highest good.

sa.text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
लोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ।
ज्ञानयोगेन साङ्ख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम्॥३-३॥
sa.transliteration:
śrībhagavān uvāca
loke 'smin dvividhā niṣṭhā purā proktā mayānagha
jñānayogena sāṅkhyānāṃ karmayogena yoginām

en.text: The Blessed Lord said: O sinless one, in this world there is a twofold path, as I said before: the path of knowledge for the contemplative and the path of action for the active.

sa.text:
न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुते।
न च संन्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति॥३-४॥
sa.transliteration:
na karmaṇām anārambhān naiṣkarmyaṃ puruṣo 'śnute
na ca saṃnyasanād eva siddhiṃ samadhigacchati

en.text: One does not attain freedom from action by abstaining from action, nor does one attain perfection by mere renunciation.

sa.text:
न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत्।
कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः॥३-५॥
sa.transliteration:
na hi kaścit kṣaṇam api jātu tiṣṭhaty akarmakṛt
kāryate hy avaśaḥ karma sarvaḥ prakṛtijair guṇaiḥ

en.text: Indeed, no one can remain without action even for a moment; everyone is compelled to act by the qualities born of material nature.

sa.text:
कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन्।
इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते॥३-६॥
sa.transliteration:
karmendriyāṇi saṃyamya ya āste manasā smaran
indriyārthān vimūḍhātmā mithyācāraḥ sa ucyate

en.text: One who restrains the organs of action but continues to dwell in the mind on sense objects is said to be a hypocrite and deluded.

sa.text:
यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन।
कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते॥३-७॥
sa.transliteration:
yas tv indriyāṇi manasā niyamyārabhate 'rjuna
karmendriyaiḥ karmayogam asaktaḥ sa viśiṣyate

en.text: But one who, controlling the senses by the mind, engages the organs of action in karma yoga without attachment, excels, O Arjuna.

sa.text:
नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः।
शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिध्येदकर्मणः॥३-८॥
sa.transliteration:
niyataṃ kuru karma tvaṃ karma jyāyo hy akarmaṇaḥ
śarīrayātrāpi ca te na prasidhyed akarmaṇaḥ

en.text: Perform your prescribed duties, for action is superior to inaction. Even the maintenance of your body would not be possible by inaction.

sa.text:
यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः।
तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर॥३-९॥
sa.transliteration:
yajñārthāt karmaṇo 'nyatra loko 'yaṃ karmabandhanaḥ
tadarthaṃ karma kaunteya muktasaṅgaḥ samācara

en.text: The world is bound by actions other than those performed for the sake of sacrifice. Therefore, O son of Kunti, perform action for that purpose, free from attachment.

sa.text:
सहयज्ञाः प्रजाः सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापतिः।
अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक्॥३-१०॥
sa.transliteration:
sahayajñāḥ prajāḥ sṛṣṭvā purovāca prajāpatiḥ
anena prasaviṣyadhvam eṣa vo 'stv iṣṭakāmadhuk

en.text: In the beginning, the Lord of creation, having created beings along with sacrifices, said: 'By this you shall prosper; let this be the milch cow of your desires.'

sa.text:
देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः।
परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ॥३-११॥
sa.transliteration:
devān bhāvayatānena te devā bhāvayantu vaḥ
parasparaṃ bhāvayantaḥ śreyaḥ param avāpsyatha

en.text: Nourish the gods with this, and may the gods nourish you. Thus nourishing one another, you shall attain the highest good.

sa.text:
इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः।
तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः॥३-१२॥
sa.transliteration:
iṣṭān bhogān hi vo devā dāsyante yajñabhāvitāḥ
tair dattān apradāyaibhyo yo bhuṅkte stena eva saḥ

en.text: The gods, nourished by sacrifice, will give you the desired enjoyments. One who enjoys these gifts without offering to them is indeed a thief.

sa.text:
यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषैः।
भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात्॥३-१३॥
sa.transliteration:
yajñaśiṣṭāśinaḥ santo mucyante sarvakilbiṣaiḥ
bhuñjate te tv aghaṃ pāpā ye pacanty ātmakāraṇāt

en.text: The righteous who eat the remnants of sacrifice are freed from all sins, but the sinful who cook only for themselves eat sin.

sa.text:
अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः।
यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भवः॥३-१४॥
sa.transliteration:
annād bhavanti bhūtāni parjanyād annasambhavaḥ
yajñād bhavati parjanyo yajñaḥ karmasamudbhavaḥ

en.text: From food come forth beings; from rain food is produced; from sacrifice arises rain; and sacrifice is born of action.

sa.text:
कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भवं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भवम्।
तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम्॥३-१५॥
sa.transliteration:
karma brahmodbhavaṃ viddhi brahmākṣarasamudbhavam
tasmāt sarvagataṃ brahma nityaṃ yajñe pratiṣṭhitam

en.text: Know that action arises from Brahman, and Brahman arises from the Imperishable. Therefore, the all-pervading Brahman is eternally established in sacrifice.

sa.text:
एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः।
अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति॥३-१६॥
sa.transliteration:
evaṃ pravartitaṃ cakraṃ nānuvartayatīha yaḥ
aghāyur indriyārāmo moghaṃ pārtha sa jīvati

en.text: One who does not follow the wheel thus set in motion is sinful, indulges in the senses, and lives in vain, O Partha.

sa.text:
यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्तश्च मानवः।
आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते॥३-१७॥
sa.transliteration:
yas tv ātmaratir eva syād ātmatṛptaś ca mānavaḥ
ātmany eva ca santuṣṭas tasya kāryaṃ na vidyate

en.text: But for one who rejoices only in the self, is satisfied with the self, and is content in the self alone, there is no duty to perform.

sa.text:
नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन।
न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रयः॥३-१८॥
sa.transliteration:
naiva tasya kṛtenārtho nākṛteneha kaścana
na cāsya sarvabhūteṣu kaścid arthavyapāśrayaḥ

en.text: Such a person has no purpose to fulfill by action or inaction, and does not depend on any being for any object.

sa.text:
तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर।
असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुषः॥३-१९॥
sa.transliteration:
tasmād asaktaḥ satataṃ kāryaṃ karma samācara
asakto hy ācaran karma param āpnoti pūruṣaḥ

en.text: Therefore, always perform your duty unattached, for by performing action without attachment, a person attains the Supreme.

sa.text:
कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादयः।
लोकसंग्रहमेवापि संपश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि॥३-२०॥
sa.transliteration:
karmaṇaiva hi saṃsiddhim āsthitā janakādayaḥ
lokasaṅgraham evāpi sampaśyan kartum arhasi

en.text: Indeed, by action alone, Janaka and others attained perfection. You should also perform action with a view to the welfare of the world.

sa.text:
यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः।
स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते॥३-२१॥
sa.transliteration:
yad yad ācarati śreṣṭhas tat tad evetaro janaḥ
sa yat pramāṇaṃ kurute lokas tad anuvartate

en.text: Whatever a great person does, others follow. Whatever standard they set, the world follows.

sa.text:
न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन।
नानवाप्तमवाप्तव्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि॥३-२२॥
sa.transliteration:
na me pārthāsti kartavyaṃ triṣu lokeṣu kiñcana
nānavāptam avāptavyaṃ varta eva ca karmaṇi

en.text: O Partha, there is nothing in the three worlds that I need to do, nor is there anything unattained that I need to attain; yet I engage in action.

sa.text:
यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः।
मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः॥३-२३॥
sa.transliteration:
yadi hy ahaṃ na varteyaṃ jātu karmaṇy atandritaḥ
mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ

en.text: If I did not engage in action unwearied, O Partha, people would follow My path in every way.

sa.text:
उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम्।
सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः॥३-२४॥
sa.transliteration:
utsīdeyur ime lokā na kuryāṃ karma ced aham
saṅkarasya ca kartā syām upahanyām imāḥ prajāḥ

en.text: These worlds would perish if I did not perform action; I would be the cause of confusion and destruction of all these beings.

sa.text:
सक्ताः कर्मण्यविद्वांसो यथा कुर्वन्ति भारत।
कुर्याद्विद्वांस्तथासक्तश्चिकीर्षुर्लोकसंग्रहम्॥३-२५॥
sa.transliteration:
saktāḥ karmaṇy aviddvāṃso yathā kurvanti bhārata
kuryād viddvāṃs tathāsaktaś cikīrṣur lokasaṅgraham

en.text: As the ignorant act with attachment to their work, O descendant of Bharata, so should the wise act without attachment, for the welfare of the world.

sa.text:
न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम्।
जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्तः समाचरन्॥३-२६॥
sa.transliteration:
na buddhibhedaṃ janayed ajñānāṃ karmasaṅginām
oṣayet sarvakarmāṇi viddvān yuktaḥ samācaran

en.text: Let not the wise unsettle the minds of the ignorant who are attached to action; they should be encouraged to perform all actions in a spirit of devotion.

sa.text:
प्रकृतेः क्रियमाणानि गुणैः कर्माणि सर्वशः।
अहङ्कारविमूढात्मा कर्ताऽहमिति मन्यते॥३-२७॥
sa.transliteration:
prakṛteḥ kriyamāṇāni guṇaiḥ karmāṇi sarvaśaḥ
ahaṅkāravimūḍhātmā kartāham iti manyate

en.text: All actions are performed by the modes of material nature. One whose mind is deluded by ego thinks, 'I am the doer.'

sa.text:
तत्त्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयोः।
गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते॥३-२८॥
sa.transliteration:
tattvavittu mahābāho guṇakarmavibhāgayoḥ
guṇā guṇeṣu vartanta iti matvā na sajjate

en.text: But one who knows the truth, O mighty-armed, about the divisions of the modes and their actions, understanding that the modes act upon the modes, does not become attached.

sa.text:
प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढाः सज्जन्ते गुणकर्मसु।
तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत्॥३-२९॥
sa.transliteration:
prakṛter guṇasammūḍhāḥ sajjante guṇakarmasu
tān akṛtsnavido mandān kṛtsnavin na vicālayet

en.text: Those deluded by the modes of material nature become attached to the functions of the modes. But the knower of the All should not unsettle the ignorant who know only a part.

sa.text:
मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि संन्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा।
निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वरः॥३-३०॥
sa.transliteration:
mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi saṃnyasyādhyātmacetasā
nirāśīr nirmamo bhūtvā yudhyasva vigatajvaraḥ

en.text: Surrendering all actions to Me, with your consciousness fixed on the Self, being free from desire and egoism, and free from fever, fight.

sa.text:
ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः।
श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभिः॥३-३१॥
sa.transliteration:
ye me matam idaṃ nityam anutiṣṭhanti mānavāḥ
śraddhāvanto 'nasūyanto mucyante te 'pi karmabhiḥ

en.text: Those who always practice this teaching of Mine with faith and without caviling are freed from the bondage of actions.

sa.text:
ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम्।
सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतसः॥३-३२॥
sa.transliteration:
ye tv etad abhyasūyanto nānutiṣṭhanti me matam
sarvajñānavimūḍhāṃs tān viddhi naṣṭān acetasaḥ

en.text: But those who, out of envy, disregard this teaching and do not practice it, are deluded in all knowledge and are ruined.

sa.text:
सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि।
प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति॥३-३३॥
sa.transliteration:
sadṛśaṃ ceṣṭate svasyāḥ prakṛter jñānavān api
prakṛtiṃ yānti bhūtāni nigrahaḥ kiṃ kariṣyati

en.text: Even a wise person acts according to their own nature. Beings follow their nature. What can repression accomplish?

sa.text:
इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ।
तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ॥३-३४॥
sa.transliteration:
indriyasyendriyasyārthe rāgadveṣau vyavasthitau
tayor na vaśam āgacchettau hy asya paripanthinau

en.text: Attachment and aversion for sense objects abide in the senses; let none come under their sway, for they are two foes blocking the path.

sa.text:
श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात्।
स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः॥३-३५॥
sa.transliteration:
śreyān svadharmo viguṇaḥ paradharmāt svanuṣṭhitāt
svadharme nidhanaṃ śreyaḥ paradharmo bhayāvahaḥ

en.text: Better is one's own duty, though imperfect, than the duty of another well performed. Better is death in one's own duty; the duty of another is fraught with fear.

sa.text:
अर्जुन उवाच
अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः।
अनिच्छन्नपि वार्ष्णेय बलादिव नियोजितः॥३-३६॥
sa.transliteration:
arjuna uvāca
atha kena prayukto 'yaṃ pāpaṃ carati pūruṣaḥ
anicchann api vārṣṇeya balād iva niyojitaḥ

en.text: Arjuna said: Then by what is a person impelled to commit sin, even unwillingly, as if forced by some power, O Varshneya?

sa.text:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
काम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भवः।
महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम्॥३-३७॥
sa.transliteration:
śrībhagavān uvāca
kāma eṣa krodha eṣa rajoguṇasamudbhavaḥ
mahāśano mahāpāpmā viddhy enam iha vairiṇam

en.text: The Blessed Lord said: It is desire, it is anger, born of the mode of passion, all-devouring and most sinful. Know this as the enemy here.

sa.text:
धूमेनाव्रियते वह्निर्यथादर्शो मलेन च।
यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृतम्॥३-३८॥
sa.transliteration:
dhūmenāvriyate vahnir yathādarśo malena ca
yatholbenāvṛto garbhas tathā tenedam āvṛtam

en.text: As fire is covered by smoke, as a mirror by dust, and as an embryo is enveloped by the womb, so is knowledge covered by this.

sa.text:
आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा।
कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च॥३-३९॥
sa.transliteration:
āvṛtaṃ jñānam etena jñānino nityavairiṇā
kāmarūpeṇa kaunteya duṣpūreṇānalena ca

en.text: O son of Kunti, knowledge is covered by this constant enemy of the wise in the form of desire, which is insatiable like fire.

sa.text:
इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिरस्याधिष्ठानमुच्यते।
एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम्॥३-४०॥
sa.transliteration:
indriyāṇi mano buddhir asyādhiṣṭhānam ucyate
tair vimohayatyeṣa jñānam āvṛtya dehinam

en.text: The senses, mind, and intellect are said to be its seat. Through these, it deludes the embodied being by veiling knowledge.

sa.text:
तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ।
पाप्मानं प्रजहि ह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम्॥३-४१॥
sa.transliteration:
tasmāt tvam indriyāṇy ādau niyamya bharatarṣabha
pāpmānaṃ prajahi hy enaṃ jñānavijñānanāśanam

en.text: Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, first control the senses and slay this sinful destroyer of knowledge and discrimination.

sa.text:
इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्यः परं मनः।
मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः॥३-४२॥
sa.transliteration:
indriyāṇi parāṇy āhur indriyebhyaḥ paraṃ manaḥ
manasas tu parā buddhir yo buddheḥ paratas tu saḥ

en.text: The senses are said to be superior to the body; the mind is superior to the senses; the intellect is superior to the mind; and that which is superior to the intellect is the Self.

sa.text:
एवं बुद्धेः परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना।
जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम्॥३-४३॥
sa.transliteration:
evaṃ buddheḥ paraṃ buddhvā saṃstabhyātmānam ātmanā
jahi śatruṃ mahābāho kāmarūpaṃ durāsadam

en.text: Thus, knowing That which is beyond the intellect, and subduing the self by the Self, slay the enemy in the form of desire, O mighty-armed, which is difficult to overcome.
